Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using synthetic α-synuclein protein.

Readout description.Result Description: The A30P mutation delays amyloid formation compared to wildtype α-synuclein.
The E46K mutation accelerates amyloid formation and oligomer formation compared to wildtype α-synuclein.
The A53T mutation accelerates amyloid formation and oligomer formation compared to wildtype α-synuclein.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were conducted with multiple protein preparations.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Buffer without α-synuclein was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Lag phase of amyloid formation within 24 hours.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Lag phase of amyloid formation significantly shorter or longer than 24 hours.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using synthetic α-synuclein protein.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P-syn oligomers were observed only when both 20S and liposomes were present.
E46K-syn oligomers were observed in all conditions tested.
A53T-syn oligomers were observed in all conditions tested.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were conducted with multiple protein preparations.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Buffer without α-synuclein was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Detection of oligomers significantly earlier or later than 24 hours.
